flawed_nl_solution:
After 30 days, there will be enough food left to sustain 300 people for 90 days - 30 days = 60 days.
After the 100 people leave, there will be 300-100 = <<300-100=190>>190 people left.
The 190 people will eat 190/300 = 190/300 as much food as the original group of people in the castle.
The 60 days' worth of food will last this smaller group for 60 days / (190/300) = <<60/(190/300)=1800/19>>1800/19 more days.
#### 1800/19

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 190. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
